result.execSummary:
The defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay only the mandatory costs all other costs are waived by the Court due to the Defendant is indigent. Mandatory costs are due during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept. 

Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab.

**Restitution set at ZERO.**
No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Cooperate with agent.
Must write letters of apology toe JCPenney and Old Navy.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
Random urine screens with no positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curmisha Patrice Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT SENTENCED THE Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay only the mandatory costs all other costs are waived by the Court due to the Defendant is indigent. Mandatory costs are due during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept. 
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.
*  Obtain a GED/HSED.
*  Community service of 20 hours.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab.
*  Must write letters of apology toe JCPenney and Old Navy.

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with court:
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY .  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with OLD NAVY, 11500 W BURLEIGH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Curmisha Patrice Davis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
